attributes.action: call a general election immediately to re-seek the mandate given to them at the last election.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: By ratifying the EU 'Treaty' without fulfilling their election pledge to allow the electorate to voice their opinion via the promised referendum, the government have broken the trust placed in them and should call a general election to ask the electorate whether it wishes them to continue in office.  This is especially the case, given that at the time of ratification a court hearing over the treaty was still in progress, and that following the Irish vote against the Treaty there was no need for haste in this matter.  Even many who are in favour of the EU Treaty have expressed their wish that they be consulted via the promised referendum so that they may voice that opinion.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
